one_reviews_text:
Instead of warning you before you actually purchase the game that you must have a stick or a gamepad, just in case you may assume that the touch IS a gamepad (of 2 parts)

These brainiacs thought it would be way more lucrative  (read "profitable") to only tell you that you need a joystick or gamepad after you bought their game

Yes devs I know it is mentioned in the specs, legally you are in the clear, ain't that great?
My pov is about common curtessy, the fact that you did think of mentionning it AFTER the sale is proof that you are aware that possible issues may arise

When I am about to buy a 360 game I do get a warning that I will need a min of 3 sensors, not 2
You could easily have done something like that

Oh, also, only telling buyers after they run the game 1st time, that not all sticks/pads work with the game, but leaving it up to them to sort out which are supported is NOT cool

1 star for not giving a ....
review_feedback:
The description clearly says "Starfighter Arduxim requires a gamepad, joystick or HOTAS". There's no option I have as a developer to put up a warning dialog before purchase, that would need to be implemented by Oculus.

There's also a demo you could have tried first.

one_reviews_text: very simple controls not to many buttons like on newer games  and really fun to play

Cool, fun experience that reminded me of Tie Fighter - running missions into space and returning to base to debrief. It's very much a hobbyist-made sort of game - but I love that about it - I'm a big fan of the voice acting and the gorgeous retro character graphics that show up when you're being spoken to by someone. I liked it a lot.
I remember helping the dev out on reddit with the Gear VR edition. I'm SO thrilled to see this on the Rift, and it's definitely worth the price if you want a simple but effective space shooter.

Check out the demo. The Graphics might not be the most beautiful there are, but hey, you really get a nice space fighter feeling! Also, the campaign is not the longest, but for the price, it is well worth it.
Those who played wing commander will love this one! 3d feeling is good

The looks are unimpressive. Hangs easily and often. Control doesn't feel like a ship, moves too abruptly.

It could be the start of something decent, but it needs a lot of improvement.

This is actually a really good game for the money.  Well worth it.  You can even try it out with the demo version for free before buying this full version.  wish all games offered free demo versions first.
